page.title: 06Birkenhead Park - Details
page.content: {Positive Aspects.} The creation of a park in the 1840's was a revolutionary idea. Low-lying marshland was reclaimed at public expense to create a famous park, the inspiration for New York's Central Park. An achievment in many ways; this captured a piece of Wirral countryside and preserved it. Today it is still beautiful and much visited. {Negative Aspects. Dutch elm disease wiped out a large number of trees, and saplings now being planted are under threat from vandals. Litter and dumped rubbish are problems. Unsupervised dogs chase ducks. Children slide down hills damaging grass. Airguns are a problem. Comments about the park include:- "Neglected", "In need of restoration", "It should be returned to it's former glory as the showpiece of the town."
